messages.message:
I'm really really struggling getting a list of values out of fairly easy tables, and do so consistently. Object detection is switched on. This is in Prod. No matter how refined my prompt, lists frequently come out in the wrong order, or have random N/As included. It would be really helpful if I could point and click on the value I'm looking for. I'm wondering if we could do some sort of Goal-seek in the background - ie. point and click and we solve for the required prompt.

Some screenshots below. I have tried probably 50-100 prompt variations. I'm sure one of our SEs could get it out, but as a regular user, this becomes quickly very frustrating.
Very consistently, it wants to grab the one but last value (318.93), and make it the third one. Almost each time. It makes me wonder why that is.

Thanks for the feedback! It is on our roadmap (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1271) to make it easier for users to get what they want. I can add your example to the ticket.

In your example, are you trying to get the "Pd" item for each row? Can you describe more what you're looking for?

Can you also attach the sample doc?

This particular use case might also be better suited to the list-of-objects type - I've found that to work well on these kinds of more complex tables.

Does each row represent a claim? If so, I would name the field "Claims" and create an attribute called "Total Loss" - adding a description of what the attribute is usually helps

yes, correct. It is the Pd value which stands for Paid. In this case, I want the total paid claim, so intersection of total column and paid row - for each claim. I'm using List of objects, not table. It works well on most others values. I have shared my project here (https://aihub.instabase.com/hub/apps/ece2896e-c023-4af0-b6f2-3aed2c822892). Can you edit and see the prompts when I do that? Will try the attribute route.
@lydia attributes works much, much better. Thanks for the tip. I still have a persistent issue with one particular value, but not a huge issue
